Class PrettyStringRenderer

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.graphics.renderer.AbstractRenderer
      de.unisiegen.tpml.graphics.renderer.PrettyStringRenderer

public class PrettyStringRenderer
extends AbstractRenderer

Subclass of the AbstractRenderer providing the rendering of a de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter.PrettyString

Author:
marcell

prettyString

private PrettyString prettyString
The pretty string that should be rendered.

result

private PrettyStringRenderer.CheckerResult result
The result of all results that actually will be used during the rendering. If result is null no line wrapping is done.

private PrettyPrintable underlinePrettyPrintable
The pretty printable that will be underline during the rendering.

The annotation containing the information where the underline appears within the string.

getNeededSize

public Dimension getNeededSize(int maxWidth)
Checks which of the previously calculated result is the best match for the given maxWidth.

The size of the widest result that still fits in the maxWidth will be returned. If no result is stored that fits in the smallest size is returned; in this case the returned size is wider than the given maxWidth.

Parameters:
maxWidth - The maximum available size for this expression.
Returns:
The dimensions that will be needed to perform the rendering later.

checkLinewraps

public void checkLinewraps()
Checks the results for all possible annotations.

checkLinewrap

private PrettyStringRenderer.CheckerResult checkLinewrap(PrettyAnnotation annotation)
Checks the size that would be needed when the expression would be rendered using the given Annotation.

Parameters:
annotation -
Returns:

render

public void render(int x,
                   int y,
                   int height,
                   Graphics gc)
Renders the Prettystring.

The Prettystring will be rendered verticaly centered between the position y and (y + height).

Parameters:
x - Left position where the rendering should take place
y - Top position where the rendering should take place
height - The height that is available for the rendering.
gc - The Graphics context that will be used to render
